CORRIGENDUM TO CIRCULAR NO. 25/2004 
  
RESTRICTED 
Sub: Minimum Standards for Civil Aviation Security Equipment. 
In partial modification to Appendix F of AVSEC Circular No. 25/2004 dated 27/12/2004 
regarding In-line X-ray Baggage Screening System, the following amendments are 
made in the corresponding paras :- 
Para - 2.3.4 : Every bag which is sent to level-3 has to-be re-screened with a 
stand alone X-BIS. Therefore, provision of stand alone X-BIS is mandatory at 
level - 3. 
Para - 5.4 : Image Generation: The minimum storage period will be 14 days, in 
addition to the inbuilt storage, if required, external storage devices may be 
installed provided tamper proof security of data is ensured. System should be 
able to detect tampering in the images storage system. 
Para - 5.5 : Oversize Baggage. Provisions to be made for an out of gauge 
(OOG) solution for large baggage and objects. The specification and detection 
parameters should be the same as for the in line systems. The OOG must be 
able to be data linked at a future time if required. This is a mandatory 
requirement. 
Para - 10.1.4: The time limit available to the operator to view bags must be 
programmable, from 15 to 20 seconds. If this time exceeds, the bag image 
should be classified as uncleared. 
2.        Other contents of the Circular under reference remain unaltered. This issues with 
the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA).
